properties.name: Acconia Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyA survey for neolithic sites to determine the makeup and the pattern for distribution of the sites.

properties.name: Ager Capenas Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyA part of the British School at Rome\'s South Etruria Project.

properties.name: Ager Cosanus Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyA program of settlement reconstruction.

properties.name: Ager Lunensis Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyAn attempt to explain the decline and abandonment of Luni between AD 300 and AD 1200.

properties.name: Ager Veientanus Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyA survey of the Etruscan, Roman and medieval Ager Veientanus, concentrating on both sites and roads.

properties.name: Agro Pontino Survey Project
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyA survey to determine settlement patterns in the Agro Pontino

properties.name: Biferno Valley Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyThe project intended to document the settlement history of the region while analyzing the relationship between the landscape and peoples.

properties.name: Campagnano di Roma Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyThe aim of the survey was ot locate the southern route of the paved Roman road known from excavations at the Vallelunga Autodrome and the Mola di Monte Gelato.

properties.name: Caracupa/Valvisciolo Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711ItalyA part of the Pontine Region Project, aimed at determining the internal structure and chronology of the settlement.

properties.name: Catalunya Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711SpainThis work forms part of an Anglo-Catalan research project begun in 1979 and still in progress at the time of writing. It combines a survey programme in the area of Banyoles (provincia de Girona) with the excavation of the Roman and Visigothic villa of Vilauba.

properties.name: Celti (Peñaflor)
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711Spainto examine the character of urban settlement in the Roman province of Baetica using excavation, surface survey, and environmental and faunal sampling

properties.name: Mid-Central Iberian Archaeometallurgical Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711SpainThe primary aim of this archaeometallurgical survey in the mid-Iberian peninsula was to document with surface evidence that tin mining smelting took place in antiquity.

properties.name: North Burgos Archaeological Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711Spaina systematic survey for prehistoric sites in the headwaters of the Ebro drainage and on the middle courses of the Río Arlanzón

properties.name: Northern Albacete Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711SpainThe large-scale and well-preserved character of the fortified [Bronze Age] settlements and the relative stability fo the landscape in which they are situated allows systematic documentation of how the centres of political control were located with repsect to productive resources and to each other. This survey is intended to provide that documentation.

properties.name: The Ager Tarraconensis Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711SpainThe project set out to analyse the pattern of settlement from the pre-Roman Iron Age (Iberian) period through the Roman period into late antiquity and to develop an archaeological \'language\' with which to record and interpret results of field-survey data.

properties.name: The Guadajoz Project
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711SpainIt was in one of the tributary valleys of teh Guadalquivir, formed by the River Guadajoz, that [the authors] decided to mount a research programme focusing on the social and economic development of the region in the first millenium BC.

properties.name: The Guadalquivir Valley Survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711SpainThe Guadalquivir Valley is very fortunate in having been extensively and accurately surveyed before creeping industrialization and commercial farming with deep plows destroyed many of the sites. Carr 2002 p38

properties.name: The Maresme survey
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711SpainThe aim of the research programme is to investigate the territories of Baetulo and Iluro so that a better understanding may be gained of their history.

properties.name: The Portus Project
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711The Portus Project, directed by Simon Keay with Graeme Earl (University of Southampton) and Martin Millett (University of Cambridge), aims to answer major research questions about Portus, the port of imperial Rome. The Portus Project is a continuation of a successful research collaboration between the University of Southampton, the British School at Rome (BSR), the University of Cambridge and the Soprintendenza di Beni Archeologici di Ostia. The Portus Project includes multiple seasons of survey in the land lying to the south of the port, as well as the excavation of a central area within the port itself, in order to provide answers to a number of key questions about Portus\' character and development, its regional context and relationship to Ostia, and its connections to other ports in Italy and the Mediterranean. The excavation will apply an integrated suite of techniques not generally used on complex Mediterranean sites with major structural remains, including digital recording and visualization. This exceptionally rich and challenging site provides young academics and students with experience and training in site and survey techniques, electronic data-capture and in the identification and analysis of artefacts, fauna and botanical remains. Bibliograhy Selected Bibliography

properties.name: The Serra de l'Altmirant project
properties.description: Posted by Fhg1711Spainaimed to map the human impact on the uplands and to determine the chronology and nature of exploitation
